company_context: Lead generation for POS solutions targeting independent small restaurants and retail business decision-makers in Canada.
usage_instructions: Use these queries in LinkedIn search bar without quotes or special characters for efficient keyword matching.
Filter results by company size, geographic location within Canada, and language to narrow down to the best lead profiles.
Prioritize outreach starting from Tier 1 contacts as they are primary decision-makers most likely to purchase POS solutions.
Use Tier 2 queries to engage senior operational roles who influence technology and vendor decisions.
Apply Tier 3 queries for supplemental leads that hold relevant influence in food service and retail businesses.

tiers.name: Primary Decision-Makers in Independent Restaurants and Retailers
tiers.description: Focus on owners and managers of independent small restaurants and retail stores in Canada to reach key decision-makers.

# Tracy Ioannidis **Café Owner & Operator** Canada, CA 500 connections, 693 followers ## About Passion tops the list when it comes to describing Tracy's many attributes

Having learned from some of the best in the business has propelled her to the forefront of the industry

Strategizing and brainstorming take her creative work to unimaginable levels

And when it comes to presenting, the room is hers

Always

Her panache has been selling ideas and solidifying client relationships for over two decades

Best of all, her smile was the envy of even Mary Tyler Moore

## Experience ### Co-Owner/Operator of K Okay Café & Coffee Roasters [K Okay Café & Coffee Roasters](N/A) Dec 2022 - Present Warkworth, Ontario We bought the Our Lucky Stars Cafe in December and rebranded it in May. We continue to serve great food and organic, free-trade coffee, which we roast on site ### Home Stager [Simply Staging](N/A) Mar 2022 - Aug 2023 N/A ### Associate Creative Director [theOtherTracy](N/A) Oct 2020 - Aug 2023 Toronto, Ontario, Canada I'm a high energy, smart, dynamic marketer who works well with account teams as well as clients to get to the key messaging for each project. I'd love to bring my vast experience translating creative needs into business results. And, after all these years I still care – going through the motions is not part of my vernacular. Now I'm looking for my next challenge. ### Associate Creative Director – Art Direction [Publicis Hawkeye](https://www.linkedin.com/company/publicis-hawkeye) Feb 2016 - Aug 2020 Toronto, Ontario, Canada I love working with and mentoring creative talent and being at Publicis Hawkeye/Digital has given me that opportunity. I'm passionate about the idea and doing what's right for the clients I manage. Clients like Citibank (U.S.), Citi CRS (Chicago), Canada Post, Rogers, Red Lobster and Cartier. When I'm not striving for great work I enjoy the opportunity to review the CRM field – judging the DMA ECHO Awards Judge (2017), or taking in the RGD DesignThinkers conference (2017 & 2018) ### Owner/Creative Director of theOTHERtracy [theOther tracy – freelance ACD, art direction.](N/A) Feb 2013 - Feb 2017 Toronto, Canada Area The Other Tracy is an independent venture. Where I continue to strive for creative collaboration with those I'm working with – to develop a product that is strategic and on brand for the clients – whether it is CRM, DM, eDM, B2B, Print, TV, or online work. I am in my zone when engaging in the client/creative relationship, it is an important aspect and one that I enjoy and handle well through well-versed presentation skills and a lack of shyness. With an abundance of new business experiences and mentoring, I'm ready to jump in whenever the opportunity arises.During my freelance experience, I've had the privilege of working with some great people at great agencies. Working on brands such as ALS Society of Canada, Bell, Citi Bank, Cuso, Joe Boxer, Kids Help Phone, Red Lobster, Rogers and more. Agencies: Aimia, Stephan Thomas, Jam Direct, Havas, Publicis Hawkeye ### Associate Creative Director [Rivet/DraftFCB Healthcare](N/A) Jan 2008 - Jan 2013 Toronto As ACD at Rivet, Tracy's work consisted of creative/conceptual development, CRM, DM, eDM, B2B, Print, Radio, TV, online work, strategic thinking, presenting internally and to clients, new business and mentoring.Concurrent ACD at DraftFCB Healthcare (Rivet's sister agency) – she worked on patient, consumer and HCP communications across a wide range of mediums - from detail aids to patient starter kits including patient videos for a global client. ### Senior Art Director [FCB Direct](https://www.linkedin.com/company/fcb-direct) Nov 2002 - Dec 2007 N/A ### Art Director [Arnold Worldwide Canada Inc](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/arnold-worldwide-canada-inc) 2001 - 2002 N/A ### Art Director [Vickers and Benson (VBDI)](N/A) 1998 - Oct 2001 N/A Tracy started here as a junior art director and worked her way up to intermediate at a fairly quick pace. Developing award winning creative for the likes of the Canadian Tourism Commission, BMO Bank of Montreal and much more. ### Jr. Art Director [Lucan, Co. 𝗔𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗩𝗼𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹™ 𝗶𝗻 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮, 𝘄𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗱𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝗻 𝟱𝟰,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝘀, 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁, 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘆, 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹𝘁𝘆, 𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁, 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀. RCC promotes and protects the retail industry through 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗰𝘆, 𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, including: 𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀 tailored to all aspects of the retail sector. results.raw_content:
# Retail Council of Canada
Empowering small, mid & large retailers in Canada through representation, communication and education #RetailMatters🍁
Industry Associations • Toronto • 30,430 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Retail Council of Canada (RCC) is a not-for-profit association representing small, mid, and large retail businesses in every community across the country. 𝗔𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗩𝗼𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹™ 𝗶𝗻 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮, 𝘄𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗱𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝗻 𝟱𝟰,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝘀, 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁, 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘆, 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹𝘁𝘆, 𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁, 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀. RCC promotes and protects the retail industry through 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗰𝘆, 𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, including: 𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀 tailored to all aspects of the retail sector. Find out more: www.retailcouncil.org/events 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗹𝘆 𝗻𝗲𝘄𝘀𝗹𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿 of retail industry headlines from across Canada and around the world. Subscribe today: www.retailcouncil.org/enews 𝗠𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺𝘀 to support retailers in their various business functions. Learn more: www.retailcouncil.org/memberservices Interested in joining Retail Council of Canada’s community of retailers and industry supporters? 𝗩𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗖𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗹.𝗼𝗿𝗴 to find out how you can become a member.

results.title: Gary Hayes - Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
results.content:
Gary Hayes
Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
Pointe-Claire, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 18052 followers


About
With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.


Experience
Owner
[Retail Adventure Inc.](N/A)  
Jun 1999 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada



Education
University of Oregon
Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Marketing/Marketing Management, General
1959 - 1963
Activities and Societies: foreign students scholarship for academic excellence.

results.title: Jeff Graham - Small Business Owner at The Albion Hotel ...
results.content:
Jeff Graham
Small Business Owner at The Albion Hotel Bayfield
Ontario, Canada
N/A connections, N/A followers


About
I began working in the food industry as a young man, securing my first job under an employer at the age of 15 as a dishwasher. I worked in many different restaurants in my home town, building up my trade in the kitchen until I was a cook. On days off I would help my father build homes for us to live in. We would build, move in for a year or two and then sell. We did this dance my entire childhood. I left the restaurant business to try something different. I was hired by Morgan’s Roofing where a learned the process of re-sheeting, building trusses and of course shingling and membrane roofing. I gathered the basic and went on to work for a home building company. We built custom homes, chicken barns, decks anything really. Following that my wife and I purchased a LGBT camp near Orangeville Ontario. Never owning a business before and not being to familiar with the LGBT community myself made a welcome and fulfilling challenge for my wife and I. We ran the park for four seasons, in which time we had our first born, grew the business and learned more from that experience than any business class could have ever taught us. In 2017 we were approached with an offer to sell the park, we accepted and sold. We then bought a restaurant/hotel in my home town of Bayfield, Ontario. We purchased one of the very restaurants I started working at as a young man. We currently own and operate this business. Always looking for new talent to hire. I am looking now for a career with the OPP. Something I have always had interest in. I am a person of growth, and believe this organization suits me well. My wife will continue to operate our business as she has developed a passion for it.


Experience
Small Business Owner
[The Albion Hotel Bayfield](N/A)  
Jan 2018 - Present
N/A



Education
Westervelt college
College Diploma, Police Foundations
2011 - 2012
None

results.raw_content:
# Canada's small business owners struggle with economic uncertainty

This title was summarized by AI from the post below.

[Sasha Boersma](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/sashaboersma?trk=public_post_feed-actor-name)

Co-Founder/Producer, Sticky Brain Studios | Board of Directors, Disability Screen Office | Women in Games Ambassador

* [Report this post](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Fsashaboersma_your-industrys-small-business-owners-in-activity-7359321201506226176-JhdD&trk=public_post_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=POST&_f=guest-reporting)

Your industry's small business owners in Canada are not doing ok. Look beyond the headlines of economic 'resilience' and talk to small business owners - Canada's in trouble. There is collective denial about the economic reality of entrepreneurship. Consumer spending is down. Austerity practices by those who have the money limits cash flow to consumers. Housing costs have a stranglehold on much of the population which impacts discretionary spending. Then trying to operate during global uncertainty with the bonus of investors (if your sector even has those) being cautious and pulling back... Unfortunately for us, it feels like Canada (including the provinces) is doing the typical thing going - if the big companies are ok, we'll be ok. On one hand, makes sense, in theory they will keep and generate the most jobs. But did anyone notice during the pandemic, how little money flowed out to employees from large companies? The volume of CEWS that then went into shareholder dividends instead of actual wages. The huge wage and bonus discrepancies between the executive class to their workforce. The mass layoffs that happened anyways? Small businesses employ close to 40% of Canadians. Small business leadership operates much closer to our employees and our customers. But now it feels like sustainable growth is impossible. We need new ideas. But we are all too tired of doing this ourselves to come up with those ideas. Colleagues who have reached out for help get financial lessons  when managing finances is not the problem. There is no shareholder value calculation that is going to inspire us out of the depression. It feels like, as a business owner, that we dont have any choice but to keep slogging through. It's not like we can quit our businesses and collect EI because we are not eligible for EI as a business owner. Maybe find another job? Unfortunately we see our peers struggling for employment right now. Many of us had a back-up through contract teaching at post-secondary institutions, but due to irresponsible government behaviours most of us have lost that too. Everyone else tells us how they are taking on the risk of our business for any number of reasons¦ but no one seems to want to recognize the risk small business owners take, and how we are left with nothing while large businesses with their investors keep floating along with increasing government support. The conventional advice is that we just need to business better. But we have businessed. We have businessed plans A, B, C, L, M, X, Y, Z and are now on plan AZ or 12M. Its the everything else going on around us that we cant control. The large entities that mislead us into bad business deals. The investors that say were too risky. The supply chain that has turned upside down. The increasing loss of consumer spending power. And the feeling that we cant talk about any of this, because social and economic systems are designed as though the small business owners are the failures.

[39](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fposts%2Fsashaboersma_your-industrys-small-business-owners-in-activity-7359321201506226176-JhdD&trk=public_post_social-actions-reactions)   [16 Comments](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fposts%2Fsashaboersma_your-industrys-small-business-owners-in-activity-7359321201506226176-JhdD&trk=public_post_social-actions-comments)

[Like](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fposts%2Fsashaboersma_your-industrys-small-business-owners-in-activity-7359321201506226176-JhdD&trk=public_post_like-cta)   [Comment](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fposts%2Fsashaboersma_your-industrys-small-business-owners-in-activity-7359321201506226176-JhdD&trk=public_post_comment-cta)

[Denis Coyne](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/denisjcoyne?trk=public_post_comment_actor-name)   1mo 

* [Report this comment](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Fsashaboersma_your-industrys-small-business-owners-in-activity-7359321201506226176-JhdD&trk=public_post_comment_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=COMMENT&_f=guest-reporting)

100%. Long story short, Ive recently navigated municipal bureaucracy around building permits. It was eye opening and infuriating. Im still traumatized. Its a real barrier to small business. I was trapped for 8 months. Thats measurable as % of my lifespan. I survived by the kindness of my skilled friends saving me tens of thousands¦ Rules and regs are importabt for safety, yes, but the systems weve built around them dont work. They punish people for trying to do it right. The people inside the systems are punished too. They avoid decisions because in that there is job safety. They dont help anyone unless its off the record, but there are barriers to even reaching them for direct communication. This isnt a system that benefits the economy. It definitely stifles small business. Now when I see a chain store on a corner I know why. They have more money, deeper pockets, and pay their way through it all via expensive consultants  or they just break rules and pay fines later. That shouldnt be the norm. We should be helping small business through. last time I checked the stats were clear, small businesses are a huge portion of the GDP.

That said, 48% of business owners already consider themselves successful, and another 48% believe they are on their way.   This new survey shows that 55% of South African small businesses may not survive the next year without urgent financial support. Rising costs, cash flow challenges, and tough economic conditions have pushed the sector into the vulnerable zone. Urgent, targeted support is needed to keep this vital sector which makes up over 90% of businesses alive and thriving. A sad reality and sadly, our government has shown little real interest in supporting entrepreneurship. My advice? Start your hustle while youre still employed, and make sure youve saved at least 6 months worth of living expenses before taking the leap. I didnt do this when I started¦ and eish, I paid for it big time ð .   Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, and it's inspiring to see recent initiatives aimed at supporting their growth! With new plans from the UK government, there's a genuine opportunity for startups to thrive. Here are a few tips to make the most of these resources: 1. Engage with local support networks  Join community initiatives and connect with other entrepreneurs. 2. Take advantage of financial support  Look into grants or funding opportunities that may be available. 3. Stay informed  Regularly check updates on government programs dedicated to small businesses. Embracing these steps not only enhances your business prospects but strengthens our communities as well. Let's lift each other up! Share your own insights or experiences with small business growth in the comments below. Together, we can create a robust entrepreneurial landscape. ### Manager, Independent Retail Operations

[Federated Co-operatives Limited](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/coopfcl?trk=public_jobs_sub-nav-cta-optional-url "Federated Co-operatives Limited") Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada

# Manager, Independent Retail Operations

#### [Federated Co-operatives Limited](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/coopfcl?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada 2 weeks ago [See who Federated Co-operatives Limited has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D1392680%26title%3DRetail%2BOperations%2BManager&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

* [Report this job](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?fromSignIn=true&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fmanager-independent-retail-operations-at-federated-co-operatives-limited-4304597412&trk=public_jobs_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=JOB&_f=guest-reporting)

Federated Co-operatives Limited (FCL) is hiring a Manager, Independent Retail Operations on a permanent basis on our Consumer Products team. This position is a hybrid opportunity and can be based anywhere in Western Canada. This position requires extensive travel within Western Canada up to 30%.

This role provides strategic leadership to Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations teams across Western Canada, driving profitability, operational excellence, and brand alignment. By fostering consultative sales and supporting independent retailers, you’ll lead initiatives that grow business, enhance community impact, and strengthen The Grocery People (TGP) brand through innovative programs, promotions, and training.

**What you’ll do:**

* Lead and develop a high-performing team of Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations Managers to drive growth and sustainability in independent retail.
* Support strategic business planning by guiding financial analysis, performance evaluation, and opportunity prioritization for both independent and corporate locations.
* Oversee program development and rollout, ensuring tools, promotions, and standards align with operational realities and deliver measurable results.
* Foster strong client relationships through direct engagement, providing consultative support and promoting TGP programs and retail best practices.
* Drive operational excellence by setting performance standards, mentoring teams, and ensuring compliance with brand, safety, and execution expectations.

**Who you’ll work with:**

**The Team:** You will work closely with other Operations Managers, will have a team of Senior Retail Operations Advisors and Corporate Operations Managers reporting into you, and will report into the Director, Independent Business. This team strives to cultivate a culture that is collaborative, results-oriented, and client centric.

**The Customers:** You will demonstrate customer focus and business acumen while supporting our TGP retails.

**Why it matters:**

We help feed Western Canada by providing fresh groceries and wholesale solutions to independent retail stores, restaurants and other food establishments in communities large and small.

**Who you are:**

You are looking for a career in Retail Operations Advisory and:

* Have 8+ years of relevant progressively responsible experience in the grocery or food wholesale/retail industry. Must have demonstrated experiencing leading or developing teams. Experience working with independent retail grocers would be considered an asset.
* Have a bachelor’s degree in commerce/business (a combination of relevant education and experience may be considered).

**What we offer:**

* Competitive salaries, short-term incentives, a comprehensive benefits package, and an employer-contributed pension plan.
* Encouragement to take advantage of learning opportunities to grow and develop as a Team Member.
* As a co-operative, we do business differently. We believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and what we offer, visit www.fcl.crs.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to ensure an enjoyable candidate experience. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we invite you to submit your requests to us via fclhr@fcl.crs. All information received will be kept confidential.

If this opportunity speaks to you, we invite you to apply by October 8, 2025.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those selected to continue in the recruitment process will be contacted.

As this position is considered a position of trust and safety sensitive, you may be required to complete criminal record check, drug & alcohol test, and driver’s abstract in accordance with FCL policies.

***FCL embraces diversity and inclusion. We’re working to create a workforce that is as diverse as the communities we serve and an environment where every team member brings their whole self to work. We believe all candidates should feel at home with us and be given the opportunity to fully participate during the recruitment process.***

* ### Seniority level

   Mid-Senior level
* ### Employment type

   Full-time
* ### Job function

   Finance and Training
* ### Industries

   Retail, Financial Services, and Food and Beverage Retail

results.title: Aleksandra Myszk - CEO & Founder of AM Coffee Studio
results.content:
Aleksandra Myszk
CEO & Founder of AM Coffee Studio | All World Athlete
Greater Toronto Area, Canada
500 connections, 1652 followers


About
I am Aleksandra Myszk, a passionate entrepreneur and dedicated Ironman athlete, committed to fostering community and promoting wellness. After relocating to Canada in my early twenties, I embarked on a transformative journey that led me from the corporate world of fashion and retail to the heart of community building through my venture, AM Coffee Studio. Established in Toronto's Roncesvalles neighbourhood, AM Coffee Studio is more than a coffee shop. It is a sanctuary where community, wellness, and personal growth converge. Here, each element—from the soulful music to the nourishing foods—reflects my dedication to creating an environment that inspires and supports our community. The studio not only offers a space for physical wellness activities like yoga but also acts as a hub for social impact, contributing to various charitable causes focused on children's health and mental well-being. As an athlete who discovered triathlons later in life, I have completed several Ironman 70.3 and 140.6 races, including the prestigious Ironman World Championships. My athletic career is a testament to my belief in pushing beyond perceived limits, inspiring others through my dedication to fitness and resilience. Leveraging my experiences from sports and entrepreneurship, I engage with diverse audiences to share insights on overcoming adversity, the importance of wellness, and the power of community support. My talks aim to motivate others to pursue their passions and make a positive impact in their lives and the lives of others. Driven by personal experiences and the challenges faced by loved ones, I am deeply committed to giving back. Through AM Coffee Studio and my athletic endeavors, I support various initiatives aimed at improving children's health and mental wellness, using my platform to raise both funds and awareness. After experiencing a period of personal upheaval, I sought to create a space that embodied healing and connection. AM Coffee Studio was born out of a desire to offer a haven where people could come together to find comfort, support, and inspiration. It is a reflection of my journey—embracing wellness, community, and the belief that every individual has the power to transform their own life. Let's Connect! I am eager to connect with fellow entrepreneurs, athletes, and anyone inspired to make a difference. Whether it's discussing potential collaborations, sharing motivational insights, or enjoying a mindful coffee break, I look forward to building meaningful connections.


Experience
Business Owner
[AM Coffee Studio](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/am-coffee-studio)  
Mar 2019 - Present
Toronto, Ontario, Canada



Education
Brock University
N/A
2001 - 2003
None

# Tracy Ioannidis **Café Owner & Operator** Canada, CA 500 connections, 693 followers ## About Passion tops the list when it comes to describing Tracy's many attributes

Having learned from some of the best in the business has propelled her to the forefront of the industry

Strategizing and brainstorming take her creative work to unimaginable levels

And when it comes to presenting, the room is hers

Always

Her panache has been selling ideas and solidifying client relationships for over two decades

Best of all, her smile was the envy of even Mary Tyler Moore

## Experience ### Co-Owner/Operator of K Okay Café & Coffee Roasters [K Okay Café & Coffee Roasters](N/A) Dec 2022 - Present Warkworth, Ontario We bought the Our Lucky Stars Cafe in December and rebranded it in May. We continue to serve great food and organic, free-trade coffee, which we roast on site ### Home Stager [Simply Staging](N/A) Mar 2022 - Aug 2023 N/A ### Associate Creative Director [theOtherTracy](N/A) Oct 2020 - Aug 2023 Toronto, Ontario, Canada I'm a high energy, smart, dynamic marketer who works well with account teams as well as clients to get to the key messaging for each project. I'd love to bring my vast experience translating creative needs into business results. And, after all these years I still care – going through the motions is not part of my vernacular. Now I'm looking for my next challenge. ### Associate Creative Director – Art Direction [Publicis Hawkeye](https://www.linkedin.com/company/publicis-hawkeye) Feb 2016 - Aug 2020 Toronto, Ontario, Canada I love working with and mentoring creative talent and being at Publicis Hawkeye/Digital has given me that opportunity. I'm passionate about the idea and doing what's right for the clients I manage. Clients like Citibank (U.S.), Citi CRS (Chicago), Canada Post, Rogers, Red Lobster and Cartier. When I'm not striving for great work I enjoy the opportunity to review the CRM field – judging the DMA ECHO Awards Judge (2017), or taking in the RGD DesignThinkers conference (2017 & 2018) ### Owner/Creative Director of theOTHERtracy [theOther tracy – freelance ACD, art direction.](N/A) Feb 2013 - Feb 2017 Toronto, Canada Area The Other Tracy is an independent venture. Where I continue to strive for creative collaboration with those I'm working with – to develop a product that is strategic and on brand for the clients – whether it is CRM, DM, eDM, B2B, Print, TV, or online work. I am in my zone when engaging in the client/creative relationship, it is an important aspect and one that I enjoy and handle well through well-versed presentation skills and a lack of shyness. With an abundance of new business experiences and mentoring, I'm ready to jump in whenever the opportunity arises.During my freelance experience, I've had the privilege of working with some great people at great agencies. Working on brands such as ALS Society of Canada, Bell, Citi Bank, Cuso, Joe Boxer, Kids Help Phone, Red Lobster, Rogers and more. Agencies: Aimia, Stephan Thomas, Jam Direct, Havas, Publicis Hawkeye ### Associate Creative Director [Rivet/DraftFCB Healthcare](N/A) Jan 2008 - Jan 2013 Toronto As ACD at Rivet, Tracy's work consisted of creative/conceptual development, CRM, DM, eDM, B2B, Print, Radio, TV, online work, strategic thinking, presenting internally and to clients, new business and mentoring.Concurrent ACD at DraftFCB Healthcare (Rivet's sister agency) – she worked on patient, consumer and HCP communications across a wide range of mediums - from detail aids to patient starter kits including patient videos for a global client. ### Senior Art Director [FCB Direct](https://www.linkedin.com/company/fcb-direct) Nov 2002 - Dec 2007 N/A ### Art Director [Arnold Worldwide Canada Inc](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/arnold-worldwide-canada-inc) 2001 - 2002 N/A ### Art Director [Vickers and Benson (VBDI)](N/A) 1998 - Oct 2001 N/A Tracy started here as a junior art director and worked her way up to intermediate at a fairly quick pace. Developing award winning creative for the likes of the Canadian Tourism Commission, BMO Bank of Montreal and much more. ### Jr. Art Director [Lucan, Co. # Taylor Del Giudice ð¦s Post

[Taylor Del Giudice ð¦](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/taylordelgiudice?trk=public_post_feed-actor-name)

Co Founder @ Quack | Helping Build Up Canadian Founders @ Project Canada

* [Report this post](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Ftaylordelgiudice_project-canada-founder-coffee-meetup-luma-activity-7366495979862155265-hBEW&trk=public_post_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=POST&_f=guest-reporting)

ð¨ð¦ Canadian Founder Meetup ð¨ð¦ Canada is in dire need for more founders and more entrepreneurial thinking We have seen that in the countless posts made by founders here in our awesome country Except where does that start? Well it starts with getting together and creating a community so we can create conversations and build with each other Something you see in the states all the time, but lets get more of that here in Canada So I am starting a coffee meetup series that will over time go across Canada Why come if you are in Calgary? - Limited to 5 founders, to make sure conversations actually happen - Free coffee in the morning - Connect with new founders who could connect you to your next deal etc. These are the events that things happen at and I am excited to be holding it! [## Director, Operations Solutions, Operational Excellence](https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-operations-solutions-operational-excellence-at-mufg-investor-services-4283964746?trk=public_jobs_topcard-title)



#### [MUFG Investor Services](https://www.linkedin.com/company/mufg-investor-services?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Toronto, Ontario, Canada 1 week ago [See who MUFG Investor Services has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D3486817&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

[Save](https://www.linkedin.com/login?emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fdirector-operations-solutions-operational-excellence-at-mufg-investor-services-4283964746&trk=public_jobs)

**Company Description****About MUFG Investor Services:**MUFG Investor Services provides asset servicing solutions to the global investment management industry. Leveraging the financial and intellectual capital of MUFG – one of the largest banks in the world with $2.8 trillion in assets – we provide clients access to a range of leading solutions from fund administration, middle-office outsourcing, custody, foreign exchange, trustee services and depository to securities lending and other banking services.  
  
With a diverse and dynamic network of offices across the globe, MUFG Investor Services provides challenging and rewarding careers. We achieve this by offering continuous learning and development, collaborative team work environment, promotion of work-life integration, and exposure to a wide variety of work.  
  
Imagine your future at MUFG Investor Services where you can grow professionally, in a diverse and inclusive workplace that rewards your contribution.  
  
**Job Description****Reporting to the Executive Director, Head of Operations Solutions, you will:**

* Act as an SME lead on projects that support strategy achievement by contributing to the redesign of new business models; streamlining processes and implementing sustainable business changes
* Scope and deliver operational excellence projects within agreed deadlines and budgets
* Facilitate engagements with clients through workshops to release capacity, increase operational efficiency, remove errors in operational functions
* Use recognized business / process modelling tools (e.g. BPMN 2.0 / UML), methodologies (e.g. Lean) to support project delivery
* Analyze & simplify complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations
* Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.
* Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.
* Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.
* Coach and mentor team members on operational excellence methodologies and practices
* Utilize your skills in the areas of structured problem solving, business analysis, analytics, design thinking and lean process improvement to help our clients drive profitability and performance through their business operations
* Coordinating workshops and delivering formal and informal reports and presentation

**Qualifications****You Have:**

* 5+ years work experience in the Fund Administration industry
* A relevant primary or advanced degree e.g. business, engineering, MBA or equivalent
* Previous experience in delivery of effective process redesign projects using known methodologies
* A great understanding of core business operations or operational excellence in the funds industry
* Strong knowledge of business process design, improvement, and management (BPR, BPI, BPM) concepts and approaches.
* Experience of data capture and gap analysis – through a process, system and people focus, mapping out a clear picture of what needs to be done, adopting, and employing the most appropriate methodologies and approaches (e.g. data mining to identify issues and challenges with As-is processes) to identify issues and challenges
* Proven ability to effectively identify process improvement opportunities; creatively developing approaches for business problem solving and ability to evaluate the trade-offs between business value drivers and costs.
* Strong understanding of business and operational KPIs and metrics, that will facilitate change implementation and measure expected benefits

**Preferred**

* Lean Six Sigma Certification (e.g. Green Belt, Black Belt)
* Agile design experience/ certification preferred

**Additional Information**At MUFG Investor Services, we are exceptionally proud of our approach to Hybrid Working. It enables the flexibility to thrive from wherever our employees work and, stay connected to their team and our culture. When we make Hybrid Working plans, we get to know the individual and pride ourselves in underpinning all our decisions with fairness and consistency.  
  
MUFG Investor Services provides all of its employees with an extremely attractive compensation package. In addition to base salary, there is a group medical insurance scheme, group pension scheme, reimbursement of professional subscriptions, paid holidays and assistance towards gym memberships.  
  
We thank all candidates for applying; however, only those proceeding to the interview stage will be contacted. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only to provide an accessible candidate experience.  
  
**MUFG is an equal opportunity employer.**

  Director

Youth employment remains a concern, with fewer temporary positions available between May and August than in previous years. 💡 For full insights and updated data, check out RCC's Member-only Retail Pulse Dashboard. https://hubs.ly/Q03D8zJJ0 [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Retail Council of Canada** (1d Edited): 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗨𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲: 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗦𝗲𝗽𝘁. 𝟭, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱, 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿-𝘁𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗳𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗖𝗨𝗦𝗠𝗔 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗨.𝗦. 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲𝗿 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱𝘀, while tariffs remain in place on steel, aluminum, and autos. With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.

Montreal, Quebec, Canada

results.title: Restaurants Canada
results.content:
Overview:
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

# Restaurants Canada
The voice of foodservice | La voix des services alimentaires
Non-profit Organizations • Toronto, Ontario • 37,784 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

## Posts
**Restaurants Canada** (1d): Yesterday we had the pleasure of enjoying a delicious Osmow’s staff lunch—an extended celebration to congratulate the team on the re-opening of their original Streetsville location, the very spot where the Osmow's journey began over 20 years ago. Cheers to many more years of success! 🎉 👏 [Likes: 26, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (2d): Generations may differ, but they all matter. 51% of Millennials dine out weekly, compared to 35% of Boomers. Gen X spends the most at restaurants, and Gen Z is reshaping discovery through social media. Learn more and stay ahead — Start reading the 2025 Foodservice Facts report here: https://bit.ly/4nOzY0U #FoodserviceFacts2025 #Foodservice #Hospitality #data #consumertrends [Likes: 29, Comments: 0]; **Recipe Unlimited Corporation** (3d 4d Edited): We’re proud to share that our CEO, Frank Hennessey, has been honoured with a Lifetime Achievement Award at this year’s Rotman Alumni Awards. This recognition celebrates Frank’s remarkable leadership, vision, and impact on the Canadian restaurant industry and beyond. Throughout his career, Frank has not only guided Recipe through growth and transformation but has also inspired those around him with his commitment to people, innovation, and community. Congratulations, Frank, on this well-deserved honour! [Likes: 42, Comments: 0]; **Foodservice and Hospitality magazine** (3d): Mark von Schellwitz , Restaurants Canada ’s VP of Western Canada, has announced his retirement after more than 28 years with the organization. https://lnkd.in/gX9zey_F [Likes: 105, Comments: 85]; **Restaurants Canada** (3d): In this episode, we sit down with Chris Elliott , Chief Economist & Vice President, Research at Restaurants Canada, to unpack some of the biggest surprises from 2025: to explore the surprising 2025 sales rebound, how the GST holiday gave operators more than a breather, and why domestic tourism was the quiet hero keeping restaurants busy. Chris takes us behind the numbers—like why alcohol sales are slipping, why solo dining is on the rise, and how his POST strategy (Pricing, Operations, Staffing, Technology) can help operators tackle rising costs head-on. We also dig into the hot topics shaping menus and margins plus the real power of using data to make smarter moves. Most importantly, Chris shares why Foodservice Facts should be every operator’s secret weapon and gives us a peek into what’s ahead in 2026. Listen for: • Why sales are up—but profits aren’t • The hidden cost of ignoring productivity • What’s really changing on Canadian menus • How operators can use data to stay competitive 🎧 Tune in now on Spotify: https://bit.ly/42Yr9JV #MENUUnplugged #podcast #FoodserviceFacts #restaurants #data _____________________ 🎙️MENU Unplugged Podcast is a co-production of Restaurants Canada & Benchmark Sixty Restaurant Services 🎙️This episode sponsored by Groupex Canada [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (4d): Restaurants Canada's 2025 Foodservice Facts report found that 8 in 10 young Canadians have cut back on restaurant spending because of rising living costs. Western Canada VP, Mark von Schellwitz joined CTV Vancouver to talk about what government can do to help Canadians struggling with affordability. Watch the full interview here: https://bit.ly/46KcCCC [Likes: 12, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (5d): It was a big week back in Ottawa for Restaurants Canada as we continued our conversations and lobby work around immigration, temporary foreign workers, removing GST from all food and strengthening the viability of the foodservice sector during this period of economic uncertainty. Our message is gaining traction—conversations with key decision-makers confirm they’re listening to our advocacy on affordability, workforce, and related issues. The response to our FOODISFOOD.CA campaign was very positive and gaining more interest. Additionally, we were able to share important context, real data and information on the use of temporary foreign workers. While this remains a complex issue for our sector, it’s essential we use these programs responsibly and continue to uphold the industry’s integrity and reputation. Read President & CEO, KELLY HIGGINSON 's full update here: https://bit.ly/42JsBje [Likes: 15, Comments: 1]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): 🌍✈️Happy World Tourism Day! This year's theme, "Tourism and Sustainable Transformation," is a call to action for all of us. From coast to coast to coast, tourism is a powerful force that drives our economy, industry, celebrates our culture, and connects us with the world. Our vibrant food scene plays a massive role in this! Every time you dine at a local restaurant, you're not just enjoying a meal, you're supporting a network of local producers, farmers, fishers, and chefs. You're helping to sustain jobs and preserve the unique culinary traditions that define our diverse communities. 💡Fun Fact: The restaurant industry accounts for approximately one third of all tourism-related jobs—making it the largest employer within the tourism sector. #WorldTourismDay #SustainableTourism #ExploreCanada #SupportLocal [Likes: 11, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): Restaurants Canada is deeply concerned about the nationwide strike launched by the Canadian Union of Postal Workers as Canadians and businesses cannot afford continued disruption. Read our full statement here: https://bit.ly/4myFELp [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): The Temporary Foreign Worker Program represents just 3% of the foodservice workforce, but it fills a critical need for rural, remote and tourism communities. Restaurants Canada's KELLY HIGGINSON joined CBC's Ontario Today to discuss the reality of the foodservice industry's workforce needs. Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/46pSTJQ [Likes: 11, Comments: 1]

results.title: Alli Herreid - Partner of ALO restaurant.
results.content:
Alli Herreid
Partner of ALO restaurant.
San Francisco, California, United States
81 connections, 82 followers


About
I am an entrepreneur from the UK. and started my career when I was 20 years old. Since then I have travelled and worked all over the world including Japan, China, Australia, Canada and the USA, learning different culinary styles and cultures. Through my journey, I have learned the values of perseverance, adaptability and constant self-reflection. These qualities have not only shaped my success in the culinary industry, but have also inspired my passion for developing culinary talent and giving back to the community. In 2000, my parents and I immigrated to the United States. After becoming a U.S. citizen, I became involved in the culinary industry, investing in many different restaurants. But none of them turned out well, always looking for problems and reflecting on myself. It wasn't until 2015 that I opened my first restaurant, ALO RESTAURANT, in downtown Toronto. this restaurant was immediately well received for its innovative menu, quality ingredients and high level of service. It quickly became one of the most popular restaurants in downtown Toronto, attracting many celebrities and dignitaries. These are the rewards of my failures and setbacks! My goal is to become a successful entrepreneur! My extensive international experience and diverse culinary background contributed greatly to the success of my Toronto restaurant. After many years of running this successful restaurant, expanding it into a chain of restaurants, opening other locations in different parts of Toronto. Now, my restaurant has become a well-known name in the Toronto dining scene, acclaimed for its exceptional food, superb culinary skills and unique dining experience. And, I continue to explore new culinary frontiers, finding inspiration from various cultures and incorporating unique elements into my menu. Not only have I been very successful in the restaurant business, but I am also active in many community events and charitable causes. I have been dedicated to encouraging and supporting new culinary talent and have sponsored many culinary competitions and events to raise awareness and appreciation of fine dining. In addition, I have participated in culinary exchange programs and seminars that have fostered cultural exchange and knowledge sharing among chefs from diverse backgrounds. This involvement has given me insight into a variety of flavors and techniques from around the globe, enriching my own culinary creations.


Experience
Partner of ALO restaurant.
[aló Restaurant - Taste of Latin America](N/A)  
Jul 2015 - Present
Canada Ontario Toronto
Alo Restaurant is definitely a restaurant worth visiting. Whether you are celebrating a special occasion or simply enjoying a quality meal, Alo is able to provide a memorable dining experience. From the exquisite setting to the well-crafted dishes to the outstanding service, Alo is truly unique in the Toronto dining scene. Highly recommended for all food lovers looking for flavor and luxury.


Education
Stanford University Graduate School of Business
Master's Degree in Finance, Investment and Asset Management
2002 - 2005
Stanford has been a valuable part of my life, not just as an institution of learning, but as a place that shaped my thinking and values. I will always cherish the time I spent here and carry these valuable spiritual insights with me as I continue to move forward. Wherever I am, I will pursue knowledge, growth and innovation in the spirit of Stanford and contribute to the development of society.

results.raw_content:
### Retail General Manager

[Staples Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/staples-canada?trk=public_jobs_sub-nav-cta-optional-url "Staples Canada") Newmarket, Ontario, Canada

# Retail General Manager

#### [Staples Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/staples-canada?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Newmarket, Ontario, Canada 1 month ago 90 applicants [See who Staples Canada has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D3020%26title%3DRetail%2BGeneral%2BManager&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

* [Report this job](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?fromSignIn=true&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fretail-general-manager-at-staples-canada-4289942774&trk=public_jobs_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=JOB&_f=guest-reporting)

**Job Description****Some of what you will do**We are seeking a dynamic and strategic General Manager to lead our retail operations team and drive operational excellence. As a General Manager, you will champion our selling model, inspire a customer-first mentality, and foster a culture of continuous improvement. Your leadership will be pivotal in achieving business and financial results, developing talent, and enhancing customer experiences.**Specifically, you will**

* Drive Operational and Sales Excellence: Model and nurture our sales culture to add value for our customers. Oversee all aspects of Brand Standards and implement continuous improvement initiatives.
* Leadership: Lead by example and with purpose, motivate and empower your team, and inspire exceptional customer service. Execute day-to-day floor leadership duties, making confident and purposeful decisions.
* Strategic Vision: Develop and execute a strategic vision to promote a customer-first mentality within the team. Inspire and work through your entire store team to bring this vision to life.
* Financial Management: Achieve business and financial targets by monitoring budgets, analyzing reports, and making informed decisions.
* Business Development: Identify and pursue business development opportunities, partner with customers for B2B solutions, and drive sales conversion.
* People Management: Manage scheduling, coach and develop talent, recruit top talent, and nurture employee engagement. Create an environment in which you and your team focus on development as a priority.
* Communication: Disseminate business communications, initiatives, and results. Act as a change leader and ensure transparency.
* Health & Safety: Ensure compliance for all aspects of Health & Safety, Asset Protection (AP), Privacy, and company policies and procedures.

**Some Of What You Need**

* 3-5 years of experience in a retail management role. Preferably as a General Manager.
* Proven experience with achieving sales and service targets with a customer-centered approach.
* Ability to lead in a fast-paced environment with strong prioritization, organization, and multi-tasking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, people are inspired by your communication.
* Experience in coaching, developing talent, and managing teams.

**Some Of What You Will Get**

* Associate discount
* Health and dental benefits
* Competitive PTO; Personal Days
* RRSP/DPSP program
* Performance bonus
* Learning & Development programs
* And more...

#WorkLearnGrow1**About Us**Staples Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including those with disabilities.**About The Team****About the Team**At Staples Canada we are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. As The Working and Learning Company, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We’re looking for curious, approachable, and passionate individuals who love finding solutions. If that’s you, let’s work, learn, and grow together.**We are building an inclusive and diverse team**Staples Canada is continuously working towards creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

* ### Seniority level

   Mid-Senior level
* ### Employment type

   Full-time
* ### Job function

   Sales and Business Development
* ### Industries

   Retail

results.content:
Michael Noble
Chef/Proprietor at The Nash Restaurant & Off Cut Bar
Calgary, Alberta, Canada
500 connections, 894 followers


About
I've worked in all aspects of the culinary profession, from small restaurants to large chains, large and small hotels and also have done a number of consulting jobs either opening new restaurant concepts or overhauling existing ones. My strengths aside from a depth of culinary experience are with people, giving them the knowlege and tools to succeed. I've made a legacy in my career of all the great people who have worked with me and who have gone on to create amazing success for themselves in their own careers. Specialties: NOtaBLE ~ The Restaurant is a full service restaurant which opened in August of 2010. The style of cuisine is "Gourmet Comfort", everything is made in our open kitchen which features a large wood and charcoal burning rotisserie on which you will find succulent aromatic rubbed chickens and a roast feature on every day.


Experience
Chef/Proprietor
[The Nash Restaurant & Off Cut Bar](N/A)  
Nov 2014 - Present
Calgary, Alberta, Canada
My legacy project, combining everything that I've learned in 35+ years in the restaurant industry.This beauty is housed in the former National Hotel, which was opened in July of 1907. The former hotel sat empty for a number of years until I joined forces with interior designer Sarah Ward of Sarah Ward Interiors to create this beautiful room which honours the many decades of history in the neighbourhood of Inglewood. The restaurant consists of the light, airy main dining room which faces into the open kitchen and rotisserie bar and which does a modern take on comforting and satisfying dishes, served in a crisp yet friendly way. The restaurant space includes Off Cut Bar - the somewhat badass, sexy, sultry and yet extremely welcoming area which serves contemporary and classic cocktails along with craft beers, great wines and a menu featuring all secondary cuts of meat, poultry and seafood.One hundred and fifty seats in all, including interesting seating areas and tables made from recovered Canadian prairie barn wood and featuring two community tables situated directly beside the kitchen.


Education
Vancouver Community College
CCFCC Red Seal, Culinary
1979 - 1980
None

# Owner.com
We make online growth easy for restaurants.
Software Development • San Francisco, CA • 28,094 followers • 201-500 employees

## Overview
Owner.com makes online growth easy for restaurants. Our software helps local restaurants compete — and win against — big national brands. Independent restaurants choose us because we give them a proven system that works, not an endless set of tools to figure out. As the world continues to move online, we're building the software that every local business owner will use to succeed. Join us! www.owner.com/careers

## Posts
**Owner.com** (1mo): "At Owner I've found the most open culture I've ever experienced as an engineer." See what inspires Staff Engineer Jay to build for the owners in his community. And if you're an engineer who loves building meaningful products for real people - we are ✨ hiring ✨ #lifeatowner #engineering [Likes: 112, Comments: 6]; **Owner.com** (1mo): ☀️ Summer Product Release from Owner! 🏖️ See what we've been cooking up for our customers 👩🍳 Plus: tune in for some shout-outs to specific team members for their incredible contributions to our product roadmap! 👏 We can't wait to show you what's next 📈 #productrelease #lifeatowner [Likes: 207, Comments: 26]; **Owner.com** (2mo): "I feel like I'm fully empowered to create incredible products and experiences for our customers - working with a world-class team of former founders and builders-at-heart" Hear about why Cynthia joined Owner - for the opportunity to make a massive impact and to change people's lives. #lifeatowner #product [Likes: 144, Comments: 19]; **Jason M. Lemkin** (3mo): A huge congrats to team Owner.com for another record-setting month of Double Double growth! Double digit growth at double digit millions in ARR! #joinawinner What’s the secret? In the Age of AI, you have to do >everything< for the customer. Everything. Effortlessly, and with near instant and true ROI. Own it. Don’t ask your customers to. In the Age of AI, the best B2B products have to be magical tools that almost instantly solve big problems for us. Automatically. Not forms and tables that make us do the work. [Likes: 247, Comments: 23]; **Adam Guild** (4mo): Exciting news! 🤗 I’m feeling blessed to share: Owner raised $120M Series C and is now at a $1B valuation 🦄 Details here ⬇️ I started Owner at 17 years old, after dropping out of high school halfway through 10th grade. I didn’t think I’d be able to raise money as a high school dropout that knew nobody in tech. The first version of Owner wasn’t built for venture capital. It was built for my mom. She’s a small business owner who needed a shot at success in the digital world. V1 of the product transformed her life. Then, I saw that there are millions of other mom-and-pop business owners, much like her. A large number of them are in the restaurant business. All of them are being crushed by huge corporations that are using tech against them. We’re using this cash to arm them to fight back. ✋ So, what is Owner? You can think of it as Shopify for restaurant owners, and, eventually, all local business owners. Owner gives them everything they need to succeed in the online future against big corporations. ▶️ I recommend watching the video attached for more details on our product and company. 💰 Round details: This round was co-led by 2 perfect partners for us: Alex Kurland from Meritech, who led DoorDash’s Series B, and Shalini Rao from Headline, who led Toast’s Series C. They were also joined by an inspiring group of new investors: Fidji Simo (CEO Instacart), Jonathan Neman (CEO Sweetgreen), Matt Maloney (Founder & CEO GrubHub). & still more inspiring new investors... Dharmesh Shah (Founder CTO HubSpot), Josh Reeves (CEO Gusto), Shaan Puri, Sahil Bloom, Matteo (CEO Eight Sleep), Christina Cacioppo (CEO Vanta), Brett Schulman (CEO Cava). … just to name a few 🤗 ❤️ Shoutout to the great team at Owner.com – You deserve the credit for getting us here. I thank God every morning that I get to build Owner with each of you. We wouldn’t be here without you. It is a highlight of my life to build with you. 🤗 And shoutout to the best cofounder and CTO I could ever ask for Dean Bloembergen . His work ethic and genius are as impressive as his character. I view partnering with Dean as one of the best decisions I’ve ever made. 🙌 I’m proud of Owner today. But I also feel scared that people will see our unicorn valuation and think “we’ve made it.” So let me be brutally clear. We HAVE NOT made it. And if we start to believe we have, we never will. When investors value us at $1B, it’s because they see potential. Our investors see the POTENTIAL for us to build a company worth tens of billions. We have to prove them right. And we must also prove right the thousands of restaurant owners who’ve bet their futures on us. ✊ We’re still underdogs. We still have a long way to go. We didn’t come this far just to come this far. It’s time to move faster, build better, and fight harder. Thousands of small business owners are counting on us! ▶️ If you want to keep learning about Owner, I recommend watching the video on this post. [Likes: 2851, Comments: 363]; **Owner.com** (4mo 4mo): A big day for the team here at Owner 🦄 Check out this post from our CEO Adam Guild to get the full story: [Likes: 91, Comments: 10]; **Owner.com** (1y): We talk a lot about our customers, but what is it like to actually work at Owner? We published our first Culture Deck as a way to be highly transparent about our values and how we operate as a team. If you resonate with what you’re reading here - we are hiring! #culture #values #careers #hiring #lifeatowner [Likes: 195, Comments: 16]; **Owner.com** (4mo): "Owner is building the future of software." Hear why Will is energized every day by what he's building here. And if you're a builder - we're hiring! 📈 #lifeatowner #hiring #ownercareers [Likes: 189, Comments: 25]; **Owner.com** (4mo): “If you’re not in the digital realm as a restaurant in today’s market, you’re years behind." See how Jay Saadat and Zia Qadiri of HillCrust Pizza increased their sales 25% on Owner, while saving thousands in 3rd party fees 🍕💸 [Likes: 68, Comments: 3]; **Owner.com** (5mo): “Everyone here can do something that will have a big impact on the trajectory of the company.” Our VP of Customer Success Gracie Binder shares what makes work at Owner meaningful. If you're obsessed with customer success, we are #hiring [Likes: 124, Comments: 9]

results.title: Gary Hayes - Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
results.content:
Gary Hayes
Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
Pointe-Claire, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 18052 followers


About
With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.


Experience
Owner
[Retail Adventure Inc.](N/A)  
Jun 1999 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada



Education
University of Oregon
Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Marketing/Marketing Management, General
1959 - 1963
Activities and Societies: foreign students scholarship for academic excellence.
